../data/lines/f02/f02-017/f02-017-03.png: experience . Topics for the six weekly meetings
../data/lines/f02/f02-017/f02-017-04.png: of one-and-a-half hours ( each held half in
../data/lines/f02/f02-017/f02-017-05.png: company time , half in the man's time ) are
../data/lines/f02/f02-017/f02-017-06.png: now as follows : 1 . Personal adjustment 2 . Health
../data/lines/f02/f02-020/f02-020-00.png: The weekend conference for the men and their wives ,
../data/lines/f02/f02-020/f02-020-01.png: which takes place at company expense in a country or
../data/lines/f02/f02-020/f02-020-02.png: resort hotel , includes an address on ' The Woman's Point
../data/lines/f02/f02-020/f02-020-03.png: of View ' and one on ' Making the Most of Health ' . Separate
../data/lines/f02/f02-020/f02-020-04.png: discussions are arranged for the wives in addition to the
../data/lines/f02/f02-020/f02-020-05.png: plenary sessions . Of the men reaching fifty years of age
../data/lines/f02/f02-020/f02-020-06.png: since the scheme started , 125 ( 37.2 per cent ) have
../data/lines/f02/f02-030/f02-030-00.png: The original scheme was planned to provide short re-
../data/lines/f02/f02-030/f02-030-01.png: fresher courses at the ages of fifty-five and sixty :
../data/lines/f02/f02-030/f02-030-02.png: the first of these is due in 1963 . Meanwhile , each
../data/lines/f02/f02-030/f02-030-03.png: ' graduate ' is encouraged to seek help and advice in
../data/lines/f02/f02-030/f02-030-04.png: working out his ideas , either through the company's
../data/lines/f02/f02-030/f02-030-05.png: personnel department or by an approach to
../data/lines/f02/f02-030/f02-030-06.png: members of the panel responsible for the scheme .
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-00.png: The latter do not regard themselves as expert
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-01.png: advisers , but are prepared to seek out the
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-02.png: appropriate sources of information or advice .
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-03.png: Towards the end of 1956 , Mr. Daniel Grant ,
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-05.png: Rolls-Royce Ltd. and a member of the
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-07.png: to the Lord Provost of Glasgow , Dr. Andrew
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-08.png: Hood , a copy of his report on an enquiry
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-09.png: he had made into the problems that beset
../data/lines/f02/f02-033/f02-033-10.png: older workers and the effects of retirement
../data/lines/f02/f02-036/f02-036-00.png: The Lord Provost , having studied the report on ' The Morale and
../data/lines/f02/f02-036/f02-036-01.png: Health of Retired Workers ' , and being satisfied that the matters
../data/lines/f02/f02-036/f02-036-02.png: raised were of considerable importance to the citizens of
../data/lines/f02/f02-036/f02-036-03.png: Glasgow and warranted further study , set an informal
../data/lines/f02/f02-036/f02-036-04.png: committee representative of bodies particularly concerned with
../data/lines/f02/f02-036/f02-036-05.png: the welfare of older people to examine the report and
../data/lines/f02/f02-036/f02-036-06.png: its implications and to consider the advisability of
../data/lines/f02/f02-036/f02-036-07.png: arranging a Conference on Preparation for and
../data/lines/f02/f02-038/f02-038-00.png: The large attendance and atmosphere of
../data/lines/f02/f02-038/f02-038-02.png: reflected not only an increasing awareness
../data/lines/f02/f02-038/f02-038-03.png: of the problems of men and women nearing
../data/lines/f02/f02-038/f02-038-04.png: or already in retirement but also a strong
../data/lines/f02/f02-038/f02-038-05.png: desire on the part of all concerned for
../data/lines/f02/f02-038/f02-038-07.png: and women for life in retirement and more
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-00.png: As a result , the Glasgow Retirement Council came
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-01.png: into being in April , 1958 , with Dr. Andrew Hood as
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-02.png: chairman and Mr. Andrew Atkinson as secretary . The
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-03.png: Council has active committees on Education and
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-04.png: Preparation for Retirement , and on Occupational
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-05.png: Centres . The former consists of representatives from
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-06.png: the Glasgow Corporation Further Education Department ;
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-07.png: the Workers' Educational Association ; the University
../data/lines/f02/f02-040/f02-040-09.png: of psychology , education and social science ; ... .
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-00.png: In 1959 it was suggested by Mr. T. M. Banks , Assistant Director
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-01.png: of Education for Glasgow , that industrial firms might be ready
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-02.png: to let older employees attend day-release courses on preparation
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-03.png: for retirement , their wages paid for the time thus spent . An
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-04.png: approach was made to about twenty large firms and in Oc-
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-05.png: tober , 1959 , the first experimental day-release course for
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-06.png: men was organised . Eleven students from seven firms atten-
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-07.png: ded a course on six full Fridays and it was made clear both
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-08.png: to the men and their employers that the venture was an
../data/lines/f02/f02-044/f02-044-09.png: experiment from which the organisers hoped to learn as much
../data/lines/f02/f02-076/f02-076-00.png: 1 . Are there differences in adjustment to ageing
../data/lines/f02/f02-076/f02-076-01.png: and retirement according to the occupational
../data/lines/f02/f02-076/f02-076-02.png: level of employees ? 2 . If so , which occupational
../data/lines/f02/f02-076/f02-076-03.png: levels are the better or the poorer prepared
../data/lines/f02/f02-076/f02-076-04.png: for successful adjustment to retirement and
../data/lines/f02/f02-076/f02-076-05.png: in what aspects ? 3 . Does the evidence
../data/lines/f02/f02-076/f02-076-06.png: obtained support a rationale for adapting
../data/lines/f02/f02-076/f02-076-08.png: programme to the needs of older employees
../data/lines/f03/f03-169/f03-169-00.png: Each time you rehearse you will probably put
../data/lines/f03/f03-169/f03-169-01.png: things in a different way . All the better ! - it will
../data/lines/f03/f03-169/f03-169-02.png: sound much more spontaneous on the occasion
../data/lines/f03/f03-169/f03-169-03.png: itself . Remember your four names - have the list
../data/lines/f03/f03-169/f03-169-04.png: with you if you like - and you simply can't
../data/lines/f03/f03-169/f03-169-05.png: be flummoxed ! Of course , in any speech a good
../data/lines/f03/f03-169/f03-169-06.png: start and a good finish are half the battle .
../data/lines/f03/f03-174/f03-174-00.png: So - see the next page ! Yes , they are waiting for you .
../data/lines/f03/f03-174/f03-174-01.png: But there is no need to be frightened . The audience
../data/lines/f03/f03-174/f03-174-02.png: will eat out of your hand - if they like what
../data/lines/f03/f03-174/f03-174-03.png: you offer them . A good start will put them in a
../data/lines/f03/f03-174/f03-174-04.png: good humour . Ladies and gentlemen ! I 'm afraid
../data/lines/f03/f03-174/f03-174-05.png: I have not had much experience of public speaking .
../data/lines/f03/f03-182/f03-182-00.png: But that 's a terrible way to begin ! Why tell them you
../data/lines/f03/f03-182/f03-182-01.png: are a novice ? It 's their interest you want - not their
../data/lines/f03/f03-182/f03-182-02.png: sympathy . And you want to get it from the word
../data/lines/f03/f03-182/f03-182-03.png: GO ! Try something like this : It is said that tele-
../data/lines/f03/f03-182/f03-182-04.png: vision keeps people at home . But you , at any
../data/lines/f03/f03-182/f03-182-05.png: rate , have proved that wrong . And they say , too ,
../data/lines/f03/f03-182/f03-182-06.png: that television makes its appeal to those of lesser
../data/lines/f03/f03-191/f03-191-00.png: May I suggest that you have proved that
../data/lines/f03/f03-191/f03-191-01.png: right ! Congratulations ! And away you go into
../data/lines/f03/f03-191/f03-191-02.png: your speech . Take some thought , too , for your ending .
../data/lines/f03/f03-191/f03-191-03.png: Thank you for listening to me so patiently . A political
../data/lines/f03/f03-191/f03-191-04.png: candidate often used that finish . No wonder he
../data/lines/f03/f03-191/f03-191-05.png: didn't get in ! Instead he might have ended
../data/lines/f03/f03-191/f03-191-06.png: this way : Well , those are my views .
../data/lines/f04/f04-004/f04-004-00.png: When he learned what was causing the commotion he
../data/lines/f04/f04-004/f04-004-01.png: became greatly alarmed , and after the body had been
../data/lines/f04/f04-004/f04-004-02.png: taken to St Thomas's Hospital it was his
../data/lines/f04/f04-004/f04-004-03.png: grief-stricken duty formally to identify Elizabeth
../data/lines/f04/f04-004/f04-004-04.png: Camp , aged thirty-three , the girl who was to have
../data/lines/f04/f04-004/f04-004-05.png: been his bride . There was little doubt of how
../data/lines/f04/f04-004/f04-004-06.png: she had met her death , and even less that it
../data/lines/f04/f04-007/f04-007-00.png: She had been struck several times with a blunt
../data/lines/f04/f04-007/f04-007-01.png: instrument , and her head was smashed in .
../data/lines/f04/f04-007/f04-007-02.png: There were signs of a violent struggle , blood
../data/lines/f04/f04-007/f04-007-03.png: on the cushions and floor , and the remains
../data/lines/f04/f04-007/f04-007-04.png: of her broken umbrella . But a pair of bone
../data/lines/f04/f04-007/f04-007-05.png: cuff-links found in the compartment seemed
../data/lines/f04/f04-007/f04-007-06.png: to provide the only possible clue to the killer .
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-00.png: The body was examined , and it was definitely
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-01.png: established that no sexual assault had taken place .
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-02.png: It seemed probable that the motive had been
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-03.png: robbery , and this was further confirmed when a
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-04.png: check was made with the woman's relations in
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-05.png: Hounslow . Miss Camp had been the housekeeper at the
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-06.png: Good Intent , a public-house in Walworth . Her day
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-07.png: off was Thursday , and before coming up to London
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-08.png: in the evening she had called on her two sisters ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-09.png: one of whom lived at Hammersmith and the
../data/lines/f04/f04-011/f04-011-10.png: other at Hounslow , where she kept a shop .
../data/lines/f04/f04-016/f04-016-00.png: Elizabeth had left Hammersmith in the late afternoon ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-016/f04-016-01.png: and arrived at Hounslow around 5 P.M. , where
../data/lines/f04/f04-016/f04-016-02.png: she had tea with her other sister , and then
../data/lines/f04/f04-016/f04-016-03.png: went to catch the 7.42 . Her sister saw her
../data/lines/f04/f04-016/f04-016-04.png: to the station , helping her with some of
../data/lines/f04/f04-016/f04-016-05.png: her packages . This sister was able to establish
../data/lines/f04/f04-016/f04-016-06.png: that she had carried a green purse and
../data/lines/f04/f04-020/f04-020-00.png: But both purse and ticket , and the packages , were gone when the body
../data/lines/f04/f04-020/f04-020-01.png: was found at Waterloo . Neither the sisters nor Mr Berry thought it
../data/lines/f04/f04-020/f04-020-02.png: likely that she had been carrying much money . A porter at Hounslow
../data/lines/f04/f04-020/f04-020-03.png: supported the sister's statement that Elizabeth Camp had been alone in her
../data/lines/f04/f04-020/f04-020-04.png: compartment when the train left , but this did not help much , since it
../data/lines/f04/f04-020/f04-020-05.png: had made stops at nine stations before Waterloo .
../data/lines/f04/f04-024/f04-024-00.png: The police began a systematic search of the line -
../data/lines/f04/f04-024/f04-024-01.png: no easy task , but one in which patience and method
../data/lines/f04/f04-024/f04-024-02.png: paid off . At a spot on the embankment between
../data/lines/f04/f04-024/f04-024-03.png: Putney and Wandsworth they found a bloodstained
../data/lines/f04/f04-024/f04-024-04.png: pestle such as chemists use , with some hairs
../data/lines/f04/f04-024/f04-024-05.png: sticking to it . The murder weapon , more than likely ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-024/f04-024-06.png: and perhaps evidence enough to have brought a
../data/lines/f04/f04-024/f04-024-07.png: killer to book in modern times .
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-00.png: But in 1897 , alas ! there was no fingerprint bureau ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-01.png: no experts to check and photograph any ' dabs ' it
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-02.png: might have yielded . It was a tough case to
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-03.png: tackle , and Superintendent Robinson , of the L.S.W.R.
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-04.png: Police , and Chief Inspector Marshall , of Scotland
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-05.png: Yard , combined forces in the investigation . While
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-06.png: accepting the likelihood that Miss Camp had been
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-07.png: attacked for the sake of robbery , they did not
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-08.png: overlook the possibility that this might have
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-09.png: disguised another motive , and a thorough check
../data/lines/f04/f04-028/f04-028-10.png: of her former men friends and acquaintances began .
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-00.png: They also had to cope with the usual flood of rumours , so-
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-01.png: me well meant , some mischievous , including one that a
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-02.png: man had been seen fleeing from Vauxhall station on
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-03.png: the Thursday evening , with blood actually dripping from
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-04.png: his hands . The inquest was opened on February 17 , but ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-05.png: beyond the jury hearing a formal identification of
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-06.png: the victim and inspecting at Waterloo the carriage
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-07.png: in which she had died , there was nothing on
../data/lines/f04/f04-032/f04-032-08.png: which to proceed , and the inquest was
../data/lines/f04/f04-035/f04-035-00.png: Day by day the police followed up likely and even unlikely
../data/lines/f04/f04-035/f04-035-01.png: trails . It was learned that Elizabeth Camp had been lending
../data/lines/f04/f04-035/f04-035-02.png: money to her relatives , and her brother-in-law was asked for
../data/lines/f04/f04-035/f04-035-03.png: a detailed account of his movements on the 11th . The dead
../data/lines/f04/f04-035/f04-035-04.png: woman had been engaged once before - to a barman
../data/lines/f04/f04-039/f04-039-00.png: This man agreed that his engagement had
../data/lines/f04/f04-039/f04-039-01.png: been broken off after one particular
../data/lines/f04/f04-039/f04-039-02.png: tiff , but denied that he owed Miss Camp any
../data/lines/f04/f04-039/f04-039-03.png: money . All the while the police were casting about
../data/lines/f04/f04-039/f04-039-04.png: for a man who had been seen leaving the train
../data/lines/f04/f04-039/f04-039-05.png: at Wandsworth . A passenger described this individual
../data/lines/f04/f04-039/f04-039-06.png: as a man of about thirty , of medium height , with
../data/lines/f04/f04-039/f04-039-07.png: a dark moustache , and wearing a frockcoat
../data/lines/f04/f04-043/f04-043-00.png: The porter at the station bore out this
../data/lines/f04/f04-043/f04-043-01.png: description , but the man was not traced .
../data/lines/f04/f04-043/f04-043-02.png: Perhaps the news of their search got around ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-043/f04-043-03.png: for a man did obligingly present himself
../data/lines/f04/f04-043/f04-043-04.png: at Wandsworth police-station , claiming to have
../data/lines/f04/f04-043/f04-043-05.png: committed the murder - but he was mentally
../data/lines/f04/f04-043/f04-043-06.png: defective , and , despite his claim to infamy ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-043/f04-043-07.png: had been nowhere near the 7.42 that evening .
../data/lines/f04/f04-046/f04-046-00.png: Even the bone cuff-links found beside the body , which
../data/lines/f04/f04-046/f04-046-01.png: had at first been considered as belonging to the killer ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-046/f04-046-02.png: proved yet another red herring , for it was learned that
../data/lines/f04/f04-046/f04-046-03.png: they had been borrowed by Elizabeth Camp from one
../data/lines/f04/f04-046/f04-046-04.png: of her sisters . A young man from Reading named Marshall
../data/lines/f04/f04-046/f04-046-05.png: had an uncomfortable time in the presence of the coroner .
../data/lines/f04/f04-049/f04-049-00.png: This man was known to have left his home on February 11 , and
../data/lines/f04/f04-049/f04-049-01.png: to have been away for four days . Not in itself a crime , but , added to
../data/lines/f04/f04-049/f04-049-02.png: the knowledge that he had gone shopping in the town of Guil-
../data/lines/f04/f04-049/f04-049-03.png: dford for a false moustache , it left him with something to
../data/lines/f04/f04-049/f04-049-04.png: explain . His story was that he had left home to try to
../data/lines/f04/f04-049/f04-049-05.png: join the Army ( presumably feeling that a moustache might enhance
../data/lines/f04/f04-049/f04-049-06.png: his military bearing ) , and this was accepted .
../data/lines/f04/f04-053/f04-053-00.png: And so the inquest , which had dragged on , with
../data/lines/f04/f04-053/f04-053-01.png: adjournments , until April 7 , finally had to be content to return
../data/lines/f04/f04-053/f04-053-02.png: a verdict of " wilful murder against some person or
../data/lines/f04/f04-053/f04-053-03.png: persons unknown . " The most vital clue of the Wedgwood
../data/lines/f04/f04-053/f04-053-04.png: pestle had been of no assistance . The killer must
../data/lines/f04/f04-053/f04-053-05.png: have been very thankful that the science of
../data/lines/f04/f04-053/f04-053-06.png: dactyloscopy was only in its beginnings .
../data/lines/f04/f04-057/f04-057-00.png: The next female fatality occurred eight years later ,
../data/lines/f04/f04-057/f04-057-01.png: yet so strange were the circumstances that it was
../data/lines/f04/f04-057/f04-057-02.png: a further seven years before even a ghost of a
../data/lines/f04/f04-057/f04-057-03.png: solution emerged . There has always been something
../data/lines/f04/f04-057/f04-057-04.png: sinister in the idea of tunnels . The building of
../data/lines/f04/f04-057/f04-057-05.png: them was one of the most dangerous jobs con-
../data/lines/f04/f04-057/f04-057-06.png: nected with railway construction ; and there
../data/lines/f04/f04-057/f04-057-07.png: were many people who believed that to travel

../data/lines/f07/f07-000b/f07-000b-00.p: SOME years ago a contemporary philosopher
../data/lines/f07/f07-000b/f07-000b-01.p: told us that there was nothing an Englishman
../data/lines/f07/f07-000b/f07-000b-02.p: would not do ; nothing an American would not
../data/lines/f07/f07-000b/f07-000b-03.p: say ; nothing an Italian would not sing ; no
../data/lines/f07/f07-000b/f07-000b-04.p: music to which the Frenchman would not dance ;
../data/lines/f07/f07-000b/f07-000b-05.p: nothing the German would not covet ; and
../data/lines/f07/f07-000b/f07-000b-06.p: nothing the Chinese would not eat .
../data/lines/f07/f07-002/f07-002-00.png: It is not our purpose to discuss this dictum .
../data/lines/f07/f07-002/f07-002-01.png: Suffice to say that few of us stop to marvel at
../data/lines/f07/f07-002/f07-002-02.png: the progress of civilisation which allows a dish
../data/lines/f07/f07-002/f07-002-03.png: borrowed straight from the prehistoric . How
../data/lines/f07/f07-002/f07-002-04.png: many centuries ago , in some cave or hilly
../data/lines/f07/f07-002/f07-002-05.png: hide , did our forebears home from the chase
../data/lines/f07/f07-002/f07-002-06.png: hold forth from a spear the welcome gobbet of
../data/lines/f07/f07-002/f07-002-07.png: meat or fish burnt and roasted in the
../data/lines/f07/f07-006/f07-006-00.png: How many centuries later did the mercenary in
../data/lines/f07/f07-006/f07-006-01.png: the Roman wars thus impale on pike or lance his
../data/lines/f07/f07-006/f07-006-02.png: evening meal . Later came the thrifty peasant ,
../data/lines/f07/f07-006/f07-006-03.png: later still the young Victorian buck adventuring
../data/lines/f07/f07-006/f07-006-04.png: in Paris , and even later our attractive young
../data/lines/f07/f07-006/f07-006-05.png: ladies toying with these primitive morsels in the
../data/lines/f07/f07-006/f07-006-06.png: gleam and glitter of our latter-day restaurants .
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-00.png: And , if certain dishes and modes of food have
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-01.png: persisted down the ages , the motive that preserved
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-02.png: them has always been the same . Apart from the need
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-03.png: for nourishment , the instinct of hospitality has
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-04.png: always been strong in mankind . The sharing of
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-05.png: a meal in those earliest dangerous days was an
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-06.png: admittance into an acquaintanceship far more
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-07.png: important than the casual meetings of the present
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-08.png: day ; the desire to share something more intimate
../data/lines/f07/f07-009/f07-009-09.png: than mere converse has always been there .
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-00.png: The truth is that good food offers a
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-02.png: unlimited in its variety and its presen-
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-04.png: showing a guest something of ourselves .
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-05.png: It is a far enough cry from the primitive
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-06.png: meal-times of a simpler world to the
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-07.png: banquets of later days , when the table
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-08.png: groaned under its load of complicated
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-09.png: dishes , and for all the blossoming of the
../data/lines/f07/f07-013/f07-013-10.png: arts around them the diners were little
../data/lines/f07/f07-016/f07-016-00.png: There was always the spice of an orgy
../data/lines/f07/f07-016/f07-016-01.png: in those Roman feasts , for instance , with
../data/lines/f07/f07-016/f07-016-03.png: tongues ; unreasonable surfeit , too , in the
../data/lines/f07/f07-016/f07-016-05.png: out of Italy into France , we are told ,
../data/lines/f07/f07-016/f07-016-06.png: by Catherine de Medici . The peasant in
../data/lines/f07/f07-016/f07-016-07.png: those days , as ever , ate sparingly , but
../data/lines/f07/f07-016/f07-016-08.png: generously enough in his own fashion ,

../data/lines/f07/f07-032b/f07-032b-08.p: essential article in their festal preparations ;
../data/lines/f07/f07-032b/f07-032b-09.p: and it is the opinion of Bassius that
../data/lines/f07/f07-032b/f07-032b-10.p: at their desserts the number of flowers
../data/lines/f07/f07-032b/f07-032b-11.p: far exceeded the number of fruits .
../data/lines/f07/f07-036/f07-036-00.png: When Nero supped in # his Golden House ,
../data/lines/f07/f07-036/f07-036-01.png: a mingled shower of flowers and odorous
../data/lines/f07/f07-036/f07-036-02.png: essences fell upon him ; and one of the
../data/lines/f07/f07-036/f07-036-04.png: smother his courtiers with flowers . Nor was
../data/lines/f07/f07-036/f07-036-05.png: it entirely as an object of luxury that the
../data/lines/f07/f07-036/f07-036-06.png: ancients made use of flowers ; they were
../data/lines/f07/f07-039a/f07-039a-00.p: According to Pliny , and others , certain herbs
../data/lines/f07/f07-039a/f07-039a-01.p: and flowers proved of sovereign power
../data/lines/f07/f07-039a/f07-039a-02.p: clarifying the functions of the brain . It

../data/lines/f07/f07-039b/f07-039b-02.p: power in preventing the approaches of
../data/lines/f07/f07-039b/f07-039b-03.p: ebriety , or , as Bassius less clearly

../data/lines/f07/f07-039b/f07-039b-08.p: encounters a certain measure of novelty .

../data/lines/g01/g01-004/g01-004-00.png: It was naturally a highly popular victory with the
../data/lines/g01/g01-004/g01-004-01.png: Londoners , but it brought heavy censure from nobles
../data/lines/g01/g01-004/g01-004-02.png: who still believed that they had a monopoly of
../data/lines/g01/g01-004/g01-004-03.png: leadership . But , at last , Gaunt sailed . Opposing
../data/lines/g01/g01-004/g01-004-04.png: him was the French Admiral , Jean de Vienne -
../data/lines/g01/g01-004/g01-004-05.png: a great sailor and an able strategist .
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-00.png: Obedient to the policy of his King , de Vienne avoided
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-01.png: trouble at sea as cleverly as Du Guesclin avoided it
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-02.png: on land . Gaunt was compelled to give up his search for
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-03.png: an elusive foe , and , afraid to return home without
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-04.png: something to show , he foolishly attempted to besiege
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-05.png: the well-protected fortress of St Malo . This
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-06.png: involved the dreary method of mining operations in
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-07.png: which Gaunt , under the Black Prince , had shown
../data/lines/g01/g01-008/g01-008-08.png: considerable skill at the siege of Limoges .

../data/lines/g01/g01-012/g01-012-02.png: fame and glory . Gaunt was compelled to return

../data/lines/g01/g01-012/g01-012-05.png: comparing the failure of a subsidized duke
../data/lines/g01/g01-016/g01-016-00.png: These dreary years of ineffective fighting provide
../data/lines/g01/g01-016/g01-016-01.png: obvious morals for those who are judges long
../data/lines/g01/g01-016/g01-016-02.png: after the event . It seems obvious that , though
../data/lines/g01/g01-016/g01-016-03.png: the longbows of yeomen could pierce the

../data/lines/g01/g01-016/g01-016-06.png: and that , if archers had no target , campaigns
../data/lines/g01/g01-019/g01-019-00.png: It seems obvious that if an expedition to
../data/lines/g01/g01-019/g01-019-01.png: Brittany was compelled to attack via Calais ,
../data/lines/g01/g01-019/g01-019-02.png: then the primary essential to the success
../data/lines/g01/g01-019/g01-019-03.png: of the French war was a navy in unquestioned
../data/lines/g01/g01-019/g01-019-04.png: command of the Channel . It seems obvious

../data/lines/g01/g01-031/g01-031-05.png: guilds of a city . A mediaeval tax was

../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-00.png: When ' his ' war did not bring victory and
../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-01.png: booty , a new group of Lords might oust
../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-02.png: the unsuccessful leaders , and the Commons ,
../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-03.png: who usually supplied the hard cash , might
../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-04.png: be bold enough to demand the production of
../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-05.png: accounts , and even at times the impeachment of
../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-06.png: the unsuccessful . But the Commons were not
../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-07.png: the people , and even a full Parliament was
../data/lines/g01/g01-034/g01-034-08.png: not yet a true mirror of the nation .
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-00.png: The people - Langland's ' folk ' and Gaunt's
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-01.png: ' knaves ' - were villeins still tied to the
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-02.png: feudal obligations of work or villeins who
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-03.png: had bought their release , free labourers
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-04.png: who worked for the highest bidders , free
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-05.png: yeomen who had prospered enough to become
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-07.png: journeymen and small tradesmen of the
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-08.png: towns , and the retainers and men-at-arms
../data/lines/g01/g01-037/g01-037-09.png: in the pay of landed Lords .
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-00.png: None of these classes , except the yeomen , paid or
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-01.png: expected to pay direct taxes . During the four-
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-02.png: teenth century , the traditional methods of
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-03.png: financing the Exchequer had become stabilized .
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-04.png: When the King and his Council required additio-
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-05.png: nal funds , they were usually granted an
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-06.png: export tax on the wool trade , collected by
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-07.png: means of that ' staple ' system which ensured that
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-08.png: prices , quality and tax could be efficiently su-
../data/lines/g01/g01-039/g01-039-09.png: pervised and controlled , together with a
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-00.png: There were two other sources of public revenue -
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-01.png: first , the Church , which wisely followed the lead
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-02.png: of the Commons and in its own Convocations
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-04.png: the foreign merchants , with whom the King's
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-05.png: officials had formerly made private bargains
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-06.png: at ' colloquies of merchants ' , and whose
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-07.png: payments were now authorized by parliamentary
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-08.png: sanction at a rate roughly fifty per cent in
../data/lines/g01/g01-043/g01-043-09.png: excess of the rate for native merchants .
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-00.png: In addition to these revenues , the King had the
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-01.png: financial benefits of his position at the head
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-02.png: of the feudal system , as its chief landowner
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-03.png: and the recipient of the fines of royal justice .
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-04.png: It was , therefore , a complicated and not very
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-05.png: satisfactory financial system in which the
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-06.png: borders between private and public purse were
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-07.png: as ill-defined as the borders between private
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-08.png: and national war , and in which the comparati-
../data/lines/g01/g01-045/g01-045-09.png: vely simple obligations of the feudal pyramid
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-00.png: But this time there was a very interesting
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-01.png: attempt to apply a sliding scale to the
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-02.png: payments demanded . The definition of an
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-03.png: adult was altered to read ' over sixteen ' ,
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-04.png: and , where the poorest were to pay a groat ,
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-05.png: the Duke of Lancaster and the Archbishops
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-06.png: of Canterbury and York were to pay ten marks ,
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-07.png: and between these two extremes a graduated
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-08.png: scale of payments was fixed for the
../data/lines/g01/g01-067/g01-067-09.png: different classes of laymen and clerics .
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-00.png: Again the resentment was widespread and
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-01.png: the results disappointing - a tax estimated
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-02.png: to yield 50,000 in fact raised only 27,000 .
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-03.png: In the following year , 1380 , the last and
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-04.png: most notorious third poll-tax was agreed
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-05.png: by a Parliament which met at Northampton .
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-06.png: There were dark reasons for a meeting so
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-07.png: far away from the capital in a town with
../data/lines/g01/g01-070/g01-070-08.png: poor communications and not over supplied
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-00.png: London was again in turmoil ; but this time
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-01.png: over a question of trade rivalry . A rich mer-
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-02.png: chant from Genoa had been murdered , and
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-03.png: John de Kyrkby , a Londoner , was one of
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-04.png: those charged with the crime . It is clear
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-05.png: from the chronicles that this was a sordid
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-07.png: The city merchants were jealous of foreign
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-08.png: merchants who could tempt court and
../data/lines/g01/g01-074/g01-074-09.png: baronage with rarer luxuries than those
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-00.png: A sum of 160,000 was demanded - a staggering figure
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-01.png: to mediaeval eyes . It was determined that 100,000
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-02.png: was a fairer target , and the Parliament agreed to find
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-03.png: two-thirds of this sum providing the clergy supplied
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-04.png: the remainder . The method of assessment to which the
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-05.png: Commons agreed was that of the first poll-tax . The manifest
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-06.png: injustice of this method had been to a certain degree
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-07.png: corrected by the sliding scale of the second poll-tax ,
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-08.png: but this lesson was ignored , and the injustice trebled in
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-09.png: weight by a flat-rate tax at treble the rate - every adult
../data/lines/g01/g01-083/g01-083-10.png: had to pay three groats , but this time an adult was re-
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-00.png: Trebling the rate was arrived at by a simple
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-01.png: arithmetic which argued that , as the first
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-02.png: poll-tax had supplied 22,000 , a tax of
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-03.png: three times the rate would produce 66,000 .
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-04.png: The only concession made in view of the
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-05.png: objections to the first two poll-taxes was
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-06.png: the suggestion that the rich should help
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-07.png: the poor - but this was only a pious hope
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-08.png: because no machinery was provided for
../data/lines/g01/g01-088/g01-088-09.png: carrying it into effect , and a subordinate
../data/lines/g02/g02-059/g02-059-00.png: In Chapter Two he gauged the nature of the heart's movements
../data/lines/g02/g02-059/g02-059-01.png: from the dissection of living animals , showing how these move-
../data/lines/g02/g02-059/g02-059-02.png: ments alternate with rests and are seen best in cold animals
../data/lines/g02/g02-059/g02-059-03.png: or in flagging warmer ones . At the time of its movement
../data/lines/g02/g02-059/g02-059-04.png: the heart becomes generally constricted , its walls thicken ,
../data/lines/g02/g02-059/g02-059-05.png: its ventricles decrease in volume and it expels its
../data/lines/g02/g02-059/g02-059-06.png: content of blood , appearing paler in so doing in animals
../data/lines/g02/g02-059/g02-059-07.png: such as serpents , frogs , and the like .
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-00.png: At one and the same time , therefore , occur the beat
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-01.png: of the apex , the thickening of the heart walls , and
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-02.png: the forcible expulsion of their contained blood by the
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-03.png: contraction of the ventricles . Going on in Chapter Three
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-04.png: to the movement of the arteries , likewise gauged from
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-05.png: the dissections of living animals , Harvey noted that
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-06.png: contraction of the heart and the apex beat occur in
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-07.png: systole , simultaneously with dilatation of the arteries
../data/lines/g02/g02-062/g02-062-08.png: and of the artery-like vein , and expulsion of the
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-00.png: Arterial pulsation disappears with cessation of
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-01.png: ventricular contraction . During cutting or puncture of
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-02.png: the ventricles , there is often forcible expulsion
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-03.png: of blood from the wound . Arterial diastole is
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-04.png: thus synchronous with cardiac systole but ,
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-05.png: when movement of blood through arteries is
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-06.png: hindered by compression , infarction or inter-
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-07.png: ception , the more distal arteries pulsate
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-08.png: less because their pulse is nothing other
../data/lines/g02/g02-065/g02-065-09.png: than the impulse of the blood entering them .
../data/lines/g02/g02-073/g02-073-00.png: ' And while the heart is slowly dying ,
../data/lines/g02/g02-073/g02-073-01.png: one can sometimes see it - so to speak
../data/lines/g02/g02-073/g02-073-02.png: - rouse itself and , in reply to two or
../data/lines/g02/g02-073/g02-073-03.png: three auricular beats , produce a single
../data/lines/g03/g03-000/g03-000-01.png: Yet in spite of the fact that his ideas did his
../data/lines/g03/g03-000/g03-000-02.png: business no good George would never conceal them .
../data/lines/g03/g03-000/g03-000-03.png: He was a socialist and believed in the right
../data/lines/g03/g03-000/g03-000-04.png: of the working class to control their own destiny , and
../data/lines/g03/g03-000/g03-000-05.png: said so . Being a craftsman and a skilled man ,
../data/lines/g03/g03-000/g03-000-06.png: George won many prizes , and though some people
../data/lines/g03/g03-000/g03-000-07.png: would have nothing to do with him , others
../data/lines/g03/g03-000/g03-000-08.png: would , and the comrades helped in many
../data/lines/g03/g03-004/g03-004-00.png: When eventually the ovens were fixed at the new shop , the tremen-
../data/lines/g03/g03-004/g03-004-01.png: dously hard work was if anything intensified . George used to
../data/lines/g03/g03-004/g03-004-02.png: mix 100 stone of bread in 12 hours , and Kate served in the
../data/lines/g03/g03-004/g03-004-03.png: shop , which was open from 8 o'clock in the morning to
../data/lines/g03/g03-004/g03-004-04.png: 12 o'clock at night . At that time pastries and buns
../data/lines/g03/g03-004/g03-004-05.png: were sold at 32 pieces for one shilling .
../data/lines/g03/g03-016/g03-016-00.png: ( In this strike , as reported in the Sheffield

../data/lines/g03/g03-016/g03-016-02.png: men were out a fortnight , disciplined and solid ,

../data/lines/g03/g03-016/g03-016-06.png: this remarkable strike raised the question of a
../data/lines/g03/g03-016/g03-016-07.png: living wage and showed the worth of the
../data/lines/g03/g03-032/g03-032-00.png: Soon they were good enough to sing at meetings .
../data/lines/g03/g03-032/g03-032-01.png: One of the helpful by-products was that
../data/lines/g03/g03-032/g03-032-02.png: they were able to obtain some respectable
../data/lines/g03/g03-032/g03-032-03.png: clothing , with which they wore a white tie
../data/lines/g03/g03-032/g03-032-04.png: and Red Flag badge , thus presenting a much
../data/lines/g03/g03-032/g03-032-05.png: better appearance . Later , on many a sunny Sunday
../data/lines/g03/g03-032/g03-032-06.png: evening , when George went to speak at Malin Bridge ,
../data/lines/g03/g03-032/g03-032-07.png: they would be there to begin the meeting .
../data/lines/g03/g03-040/g03-040-00.png: As they became known the Choir went to working-
../data/lines/g03/g03-040/g03-040-01.png: men's clubs , to Conisborough on cheap trips to
../data/lines/g03/g03-040/g03-040-02.png: sing to the miners , and sang for other organisations such
../data/lines/g03/g03-040/g03-040-03.png: as the Bakers' Union , for whom they went on Satur-
../data/lines/g03/g03-040/g03-040-04.png: day evenings to the Corner Pin Hotel , to rally
../data/lines/g03/g03-040/g03-040-05.png: the members . The B.S.P. also rented pleasant rooms
../data/lines/g03/g03-040/g03-040-06.png: on West Street , where a successful Sunday
../data/lines/g03/g03-043/g03-043-00.png: One of the students was young
../data/lines/g03/g03-043/g03-043-03.png: George often spoke at the Sunday school .
../data/lines/g03/g03-043/g03-043-04.png: He christened the babies . Also , when
../data/lines/g03/g03-043/g03-043-05.png: called upon to do so , he would officiate
../data/lines/g03/g03-043/g03-043-06.png: at funerals . Religion was one of his pet
../data/lines/g03/g03-043/g03-043-08.png: with the Bible , which he had
../data/lines/g03/g03-043/g03-043-09.png: read in prison where it was the
../data/lines/g03/g03-049/g03-049-00.png: Although his ideas were diametrically opposed
../data/lines/g03/g03-049/g03-049-01.png: to those of parsons he got on wonderfully well
../data/lines/g03/g03-049/g03-049-02.png: with them , particularly those who , like the Rev.
../data/lines/g03/g03-049/g03-049-03.png: Conrad Noel , the eloquent leader of
../data/lines/g03/g03-049/g03-049-04.png: the Church Socialist League , genuinely advocated
../data/lines/g03/g03-049/g03-049-05.png: socialism . With such men , who had the
../data/lines/g03/g03-049/g03-049-06.png: courage of their convictions and their
../data/lines/g03/g03-049/g03-049-07.png: Christianity , common ground could be found .
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-00.png: There was no abatement in political
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-01.png: work . The British Socialist Party endea-
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-02.png: voured to get more socialist members sent to the
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-03.png: Council , and to Parliament , being deter-
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-04.png: mined and obdurate in their attitude that
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-05.png: their candidate must go forward in the
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-06.png: elections . In the Sheffield Trades and Labour
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-08.png: had said , ' Mr. Barton would go to the poll .
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-09.png: Just as the Labour Party had fought the
../data/lines/g03/g03-052/g03-052-10.png: Liberals , they were going to fight the Labour
../data/lines/g03/g03-058/g03-058-00.png: This new party , the British Socialist Party , was
../data/lines/g03/g03-058/g03-058-01.png: not prepared to accept the role of junior helper
../data/lines/g03/g03-058/g03-058-02.png: in the Labour movement , or of only providing
../data/lines/g03/g03-058/g03-058-03.png: propaganda in order to increase the volume of
../data/lines/g03/g03-058/g03-058-04.png: socialist thought in the city , but sought to create
../data/lines/g03/g03-058/g03-058-05.png: in the Labour movement a more militant attitude
../data/lines/g03/g03-058/g03-058-06.png: capable of achieving socialism for the working
../data/lines/g03/g03-064/g03-064-00.png: Alf Barton , who in 1911 was presented
../data/lines/g03/g03-064/g03-064-01.png: with a book on the life of Marx ,
../data/lines/g03/g03-064/g03-064-02.png: and a gold purse in recognition of his
../data/lines/g03/g03-064/g03-064-03.png: work for the movement , was later
../data/lines/g03/g03-064/g03-064-04.png: known to say that it was not ne-
../data/lines/g03/g03-064/g03-064-05.png: cessary to understand Marxism in order to
../data/lines/g03/g03-064/g03-064-06.png: understand socialism , though at this time
../data/lines/g03/g03-064/g03-064-07.png: he was a keen member of the B.S.P. .

../data/lines/g04/g04-007/g04-007-00.png: The Hall proved most useful , especially in winter
../data/lines/g04/g04-007/g04-007-01.png: when the distance to the church deterred many from
../data/lines/g04/g04-007/g04-007-02.png: coming to Sunday Evensong . We managed to furnish
../data/lines/g04/g04-007/g04-007-03.png: a table with cross and candles , and the people
../data/lines/g04/g04-007/g04-007-04.png: appreciated the Church Hall for worship as well
../data/lines/g04/g04-007/g04-007-05.png: as for more secular purposes . In 1910 Dr. Talbot
../data/lines/g04/g04-007/g04-007-06.png: was translated to Winchester , and Dr. Hubert
../data/lines/g04/g04-011/g04-011-00.png: Meanwhile I had been asked to do a bit of Diocesan
../data/lines/g04/g04-011/g04-011-01.png: work in connection with Higher Religious Education , and
../data/lines/g04/g04-011/g04-011-02.png: to become the Southwark Secretary of the Church Reading
../data/lines/g04/g04-011/g04-011-03.png: Union . This meant organizing lectures and courses of
../data/lines/g04/g04-011/g04-011-04.png: religious instruction through the Diocese , and I
../data/lines/g04/g04-011/g04-011-05.png: also found myself a member of the Diocesan
../data/lines/g04/g04-011/g04-011-06.png: Conference , where I remember introducing myself as
../data/lines/g04/g04-011/g04-011-07.png: the incumbent of the highest church in the
../data/lines/g04/g04-014/g04-014-00.png: There was a somewhat shocked atmosphere in
../data/lines/g04/g04-014/g04-014-01.png: some quarters , until I explained that my church
../data/lines/g04/g04-014/g04-014-02.png: was 800 feet high above the sea level ! The
../data/lines/g04/g04-014/g04-014-03.png: work was growing pretty heavy , and we managed
../data/lines/g04/g04-014/g04-014-04.png: to get a stipendiary layman who could help
../data/lines/g04/g04-014/g04-014-05.png: among the children and young people .
../data/lines/g04/g04-017/g04-017-00.png: It was while I was at Tatsfield that I first visited Oberammergau
../data/lines/g04/g04-017/g04-017-01.png: in Bavaria to witness the Passion Play . The place and its people were
../data/lines/g04/g04-017/g04-017-02.png: to play an important part in my life . For five years in succession till
../data/lines/g04/g04-017/g04-017-03.png: war broke out in 1914 , I spent my summer holidays there and became
../data/lines/g04/g04-017/g04-017-04.png: very intimate with the people and the environs . Every year between the
../data/lines/g04/g04-017/g04-017-05.png: Passion Plays , an interval of ten years , another play would be
../data/lines/g04/g04-017/g04-017-06.png: performed at the small theatre in the village , when new talent would
../data/lines/g04/g04-022/g04-022-00.png: After the First World War , 1914 , I did not visit
../data/lines/g04/g04-022/g04-022-01.png: Germany for ten years , by which time in
../data/lines/g04/g04-022/g04-022-02.png: 1924 I was in a different parish in Surrey .
../data/lines/g04/g04-022/g04-022-03.png: Towards the end of my five and a half years'
../data/lines/g04/g04-022/g04-022-04.png: incumbency I was asked if I would start
../data/lines/g04/g04-022/g04-022-05.png: a village choral society and conduct it .
../data/lines/g04/g04-022/g04-022-06.png: This opened up a new interest , and we plunged
../data/lines/g04/g04-026/g04-026-00.png: First of all simple part-songs : I found only one member who had
../data/lines/g04/g04-026/g04-026-01.png: any idea of reading music . This was the village doctor who was an
../data/lines/g04/g04-026/g04-026-02.png: old school friend at Clifton . He could sustain the tenor part quite well
../data/lines/g04/g04-026/g04-026-03.png: and lead the others . As for basses and altos the conductor had to
../data/lines/g04/g04-026/g04-026-04.png: teach by singing the parts with them . It was very amusing , and by
../data/lines/g04/g04-026/g04-026-05.png: the end of a few months an enthusiastic choir of men and women
../data/lines/g04/g04-026/g04-026-06.png: could render simple part-singing tolerably well .
../data/lines/g04/g04-032/g04-032-00.png: Then we went to work on Coleridge Taylor's ' Hiawatha's
../data/lines/g04/g04-032/g04-032-01.png: Wedding Feast . ' Enthusiasm grew , and in a few more months we
../data/lines/g04/g04-032/g04-032-02.png: gave a concert at which the accompanist was the village schoolmaster ,
../data/lines/g04/g04-032/g04-032-03.png: and the tenor solo ' Onaway awake ' was sung by the Rector .
../data/lines/g04/g04-032/g04-032-04.png: Friends from Limpsfield , in addition to the villagers , came up ,
../data/lines/g04/g04-036/g04-036-00.png: IN 1913 Dr. Burge , Bishop of Southwark , asked me to go as
../data/lines/g04/g04-036/g04-036-01.png: Vicar of St. Mark's , Woodcote , Purley , a new church built
../data/lines/g04/g04-036/g04-036-02.png: by the well-known architect Mr. George Fellowes Prynne ,
../data/lines/g04/g04-036/g04-036-03.png: who was to become a very intimate friend , and I was
../data/lines/g04/g04-036/g04-036-04.png: later on joint executor of his estate with his
../data/lines/g04/g04-036/g04-036-05.png: solicitor cousin . As Bishop Talbot had told me that I
../data/lines/g04/g04-036/g04-036-06.png: ought not to spend many years in Tatsfield , we held
../data/lines/g04/g04-039/g04-039-00.png: My eldest brother was then living in Limpsfield with
../data/lines/g04/g04-039/g04-039-01.png: his family , and found a very suitable house nearby
../data/lines/g04/g04-039/g04-039-02.png: where my mother settled , and eventually died in 1926
../data/lines/g04/g04-039/g04-039-03.png: at the age of 92 . Dr. Burge was not able to be present
../data/lines/g04/g04-039/g04-039-04.png: at the Institution and Induction Service in St. Mark's .
../data/lines/g04/g04-039/g04-039-05.png: This was taken by the Suffragan Bishop of Woolwich ,
../data/lines/g04/g04-039/g04-039-06.png: Dr. John Leake , who lived at Blackheath , and was
../data/lines/g04/g04-043/g04-043-00.png: But what a change from the dear little old church
../data/lines/g04/g04-043/g04-043-01.png: at Tatsfield to the great modern church of St. Mark's
../data/lines/g04/g04-043/g04-043-02.png: at Purley . One felt at Tatsfield that , small as the
../data/lines/g04/g04-043/g04-043-03.png: church was , it had its own atmosphere , and for centuries
../data/lines/g04/g04-043/g04-043-04.png: had been a House of Prayer . I could not but feel the
../data/lines/g04/g04-043/g04-043-05.png: chilliness of the new church , beautiful as it was and is .
../data/lines/g04/g04-043/g04-043-06.png: When we had found a group of people who gladly
../data/lines/g04/g04-043/g04-043-07.png: co-operated , we made the little side chapel a place
../data/lines/g04/g04-048/g04-048-00.png: I suggested to the congregation that it needed
../data/lines/g04/g04-048/g04-048-01.png: warming up by constant prayer and worship , and we
../data/lines/g04/g04-048/g04-048-02.png: found many to help . Gifts of candlesticks and
../data/lines/g04/g04-048/g04-048-03.png: stained-glass lancet windows - finally a new altar -
../data/lines/g04/g04-048/g04-048-04.png: helped to furnish the chapel as a little sanctuary
../data/lines/g04/g04-048/g04-048-05.png: for prayer and quiet . In time we received similar
../data/lines/g04/g04-048/g04-048-06.png: gifts for the High Altar , and large East and West
../data/lines/g04/g04-052/g04-052-00.png: It was very interesting to have the privilege of filling
../data/lines/g04/g04-052/g04-052-01.png: such a beautiful building with suitable fittings ; I made
../data/lines/g04/g04-052/g04-052-02.png: a rule that all gifts should be submitted for approval to
../data/lines/g04/g04-052/g04-052-03.png: the architect , himself a fine artist . It is quite possible
../data/lines/g04/g04-052/g04-052-04.png: to put beautiful things into a beautiful church
../data/lines/g04/g04-052/g04-052-05.png: and yet spoil the building with ornaments unsui-
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-00.png: We also had a little Mission Hall leading off
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-01.png: the Brighton Road , in a street full of small houses .
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-02.png: This was called Ellen Avenue when I first went
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-03.png: there , but was soon changed into the better-
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-04.png: sounding name of Lansdowne Road . There
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-05.png: were lots of children there , and we had
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-06.png: a flourishing Sunday School and an evening
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-07.png: service . I soon saw that the parish needed
../data/lines/g04/g04-055/g04-055-08.png: more help both at the church and Mission
../data/lines/g04/g04-060/g04-060-00.png: The Church Army Captain had done very good work in the
../data/lines/g04/g04-060/g04-060-01.png: Lansdowne Road district , but I needed more help in the
../data/lines/g04/g04-060/g04-060-02.png: church for the full rota of services on Sundays and weekdays .
../data/lines/g04/g04-060/g04-060-03.png: Most fortunately I was able to engage the Rev. E. U. Evitt in
../data/lines/g04/g04-060/g04-060-04.png: 1913 soon after I had come , and he organized the Mission
../data/lines/g04/g04-060/g04-060-05.png: district and got to know , and be known by , many of
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-00.png: A great blow disturbed all our efforts in the following
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-01.png: year , 1914 , when war broke out . Very soon Chaplains for
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-02.png: the Forces were urgently needed , and I felt clearly
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-03.png: that one of us must volunteer . The Bishop , Dr. Burge , did
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-04.png: not wish me to go then , as I had barely been in the parish
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-05.png: for a year . Mr. Evitt , however , was much less committed
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-06.png: than his Vicar , and he was accepted at once and
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-07.png: was very soon in France where he did splendid
../data/lines/g04/g04-063/g04-063-08.png: work until his health broke down and he had a bad
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-00.png: Meanwhile in Purley there was much activity and much
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-01.png: co-operation especially with the other Christian communities .
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-02.png: At a large public meeting we launched the project known as the
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-03.png: ' Coulsdon and Purley Patriotic Fund ' in whose counsels and committees
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-04.png: I found myself deeply involved . At first , the main work was to help
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-05.png: wives and relations of the soldiers to get their ' Separation '
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-06.png: allowances , but soon , alas ! , as casualties began and increased
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-07.png: in the winter of 1914 and 1915 the matter of War Pensions
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-08.png: became very urgent , and I was asked to be Chairman
../data/lines/g04/g04-068/g04-068-09.png: of the Committee in Coulsdon and Purley .
../data/lines/g04/g04-072/g04-072-00.png: Indeed , for the next seventeen years , during my time at
../data/lines/g04/g04-072/g04-072-01.png: Purley , and from 1922 at Surbiton , I was continuously
../data/lines/g04/g04-072/g04-072-02.png: Chairman of the local War Pensions Committee . This
../data/lines/g04/g04-072/g04-072-03.png: task involved a very great deal of detailed work for
../data/lines/g04/g04-072/g04-072-04.png: the Committee . We had a splendid body of local residents ,
../data/lines/g04/g04-072/g04-072-05.png: and a series of excellent Honorary Secretaries . Our
../data/lines/g04/g04-072/g04-072-06.png: Committee met once a week in the evenings , and
../data/lines/g04/g04-072/g04-072-07.png: included professional men from every walk of
../data/lines/g04/g04-077/g04-077-00.png: Very soon we managed to get a hut in Purley where soldiers
../data/lines/g04/g04-077/g04-077-01.png: were very welcome and the ladies organized a canteen . Life was
../data/lines/g04/g04-077/g04-077-02.png: in those years more than busy . We now had a vicarage next
../data/lines/g04/g04-077/g04-077-03.png: to the church , and I was most fortunate in having for eight
../data/lines/g04/g04-077/g04-077-04.png: years a most able and devoted housekeeper whom I had known
../data/lines/g04/g04-077/g04-077-05.png: well in Limpsfield where she had a house next to the
../data/lines/g04/g04-081/g04-081-00.png: On hearing that I was to leave Tatsfield and come to
../data/lines/g04/g04-081/g04-081-01.png: Purley she offered to come and look after me . She was
../data/lines/g04/g04-081/g04-081-02.png: a real treasure , of yeoman stock and clever in all domestic
../data/lines/g04/g04-081/g04-081-03.png: things , a widow who knew how to look after the ' boy , '
../data/lines/g04/g04-081/g04-081-04.png: who was the only other occupant of the house when
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-00.png: We gathered together a splendid Sunday
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-01.png: afternoon service at the church , each child
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-02.png: being given a number which , as they came into
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-03.png: church , they could just whisper to
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-04.png: the superintendent who filled in the regi-
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-05.png: ster at her own home . Each child had a
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-06.png: picture given them and the lesson was
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-07.png: largely based on this . It was on a
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-08.png: stamp which could be stuck in
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-09.png: their book , and there was quite a
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-10.png: clamour for back stamps if a child
../data/lines/g04/g04-088/g04-088-11.png: had to miss the Sunday Church from any cause
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-00.png: It was quite amusing to see how much
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-01.png: the children enjoyed the service , and I heard
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-02.png: of parents or faithful nurses threaten any
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-03.png: naughty child with the penalty of not being
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-04.png: allowed to come to the Children's Church
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-05.png: on Sunday afternoon . I hope the threat
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-06.png: kept them good in the week , but anyway
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-07.png: they were a most delightful lot , and
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-08.png: it is a great joy to meet them now
../data/lines/g04/g04-092/g04-092-09.png: fifty years afterwards when so many
../data/lines/g04/g04-095/g04-095-00.png: Speaking of churchwardens and children leads
../data/lines/g04/g04-095/g04-095-01.png: me at once to chronicle a most intimate and
../data/lines/g04/g04-095/g04-095-02.png: lasting friendship begun in 1913 in Purley and
../data/lines/g04/g04-095/g04-095-03.png: continuing till old age to-day . When I went
../data/lines/g04/g04-095/g04-095-04.png: to St. Mark's , the first contact I made was
../data/lines/g04/g04-095/g04-095-05.png: with the Vicar's Warden , Mr. F. W. Charlton
../data/lines/g04/g04-095/g04-095-06.png: and his family , the youngest of whose three
../data/lines/g04/g04-095/g04-095-07.png: sons was just coming into the world in this year
../data/lines/g04/g04-098/g04-098-00.png: From then till now the acquaintance ripened into a very
../data/lines/g04/g04-098/g04-098-01.png: deep friendship which I have taken with me through
../data/lines/g04/g04-098/g04-098-02.png: all the many vicissitudes of a long ministry . Mr. and
../data/lines/g04/g04-098/g04-098-03.png: Mrs. Charlton have been from the first difficult
../data/lines/g04/g04-098/g04-098-04.png: years of war , when most lives were upset and
../data/lines/g04/g04-098/g04-098-05.png: some tempers were easily frayed , the most
../data/lines/g04/g04-101/g04-101-00.png: Their homes - for since those years they have
../data/lines/g04/g04-101/g04-101-01.png: lived on in Purley - have always been
../data/lines/g04/g04-101/g04-101-02.png: havens of rest , and the welcome has never
../data/lines/g04/g04-101/g04-101-03.png: failed . Their three boys , now successful men ,
../data/lines/g04/g04-101/g04-101-04.png: were in our Children's Church from the
../data/lines/g04/g04-101/g04-101-05.png: outset , and when we don't see one
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-00.png: In those early years 1914-18 , life was very full
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-01.png: both in the parish and in the wider war activities .
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-02.png: The Bishop , knowing that I spent my holidays in
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-03.png: Bavaria , asked me if I would do something for two wards
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-04.png: at the Royal Herbert Hospital , full of war prisoners .
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-05.png: I was very glad to help in this way , and visited them
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-06.png: frequently , establishing at once a friendly contact with
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-07.png: the Bavarian wounded who were delighted to find
../data/lines/g04/g04-104/g04-104-08.png: someone who knew their native villages .
../data/lines/g04/g04-108/g04-108-00.png: I could at once notice the great antagonism
../data/lines/g04/g04-108/g04-108-01.png: between the Bavarians and the Prussians who openly
../data/lines/g04/g04-108/g04-108-02.png: scorned these more simple country folk .
../data/lines/g05/g05-087/g05-087-00.png: Less than no response from the Russian side led
../data/lines/g05/g05-087/g05-087-01.png: one to fear that the event might well have the
../data/lines/g05/g05-087/g05-087-02.png: outcome that the Nazis evidently hoped might
../data/lines/g05/g05-087/g05-087-03.png: lead to disaster . Then there had been much talk of
../data/lines/g05/g05-087/g05-087-04.png: the setting up among the German population of a
../data/lines/g05/g05-087/g05-087-05.png: general system of " francs-tireurs " , to be named
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-00.png: The Nazi fortress concept turned out to be nothing
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-01.png: more than a fantasy . Thanks to the good
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-02.png: sense of the front line soldiers , the
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-03.png: meeting of East and West was marked by
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-04.png: the use of no weapon more lethal than
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-05.png: vodka . And the effect on the German people
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-06.png: of the first ten years of the promised
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-07.png: thousand of Nazi rule , so far from creating
../data/lines/g05/g05-094/g05-094-08.png: a spirit of warlike frenzy , had produced
../data/lines/g05/g05-098/g05-098-00.png: So far had our thinking led us in this matter of the
../data/lines/g05/g05-098/g05-098-01.png: " Werewolves " that we had contemplated the necessity of very
../data/lines/g05/g05-098/g05-098-02.png: special precautions to guard the lives of our airmen . Particular
../data/lines/g05/g05-098/g05-098-03.png: hatred , we felt , was bound to be aimed at the representatives of
../data/lines/g05/g05-098/g05-098-04.png: those who had , over the years , spread such ghastly havoc , destruction
../data/lines/g05/g05-098/g05-098-05.png: and death over Germany , causing such wholesale slaughter among
../data/lines/g05/g05-098/g05-098-06.png: men , women and children , old and young alike .
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-00.p: By the end of the month he still delighted in
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-01.p: Naples . He told Cloncurry that he enjoyed it as
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-02.p: much as his health permitted him to enjoy any-
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-03.p: thing . ' The Pearl ' , he wrote , ' is arrived , which
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-04.p: is a great resource . Vesuvius seems to be tired ;
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-05.p: # he is going out fast ... . What a gay , lively
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-06.p: people , and what a busy town . At Rome , every
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-07.p: other man was a priest : here the priest is
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-08.p: 1superceded by the soldier - a favourable change
../data/lines/g06/g06-011a/g06-011a-09.p: in my eye , particularly as the troops are very

../data/lines/g06/g06-011b/g06-011b-02.p: enjoyed it as much as his health

../data/lines/g06/g06-011f/g06-011f-01.p: told Cloncurry that he enjoyed it as much as his health permitted
../data/lines/g06/g06-011f/g06-011f-02.p: him to enjoy anything . ' The Pearl ' , he wrote , ' is arrived , which is
../data/lines/g06/g06-011f/g06-011f-03.p: a great resource . Vesuvius seems to be tired ; he is going out

../data/lines/g06/g06-096/g06-096-00.png: The reply was not bereft of asperity : ' Beaudesert ,
../data/lines/g06/g06-096/g06-096-01.png: Sept. 27 , 1835 ' Dear Melbourne , ' I have received
../data/lines/g06/g06-096/g06-096-02.png: your letter of yesterday . ' I am not prepared to spend
../data/lines/g06/g06-096/g06-096-03.png: the remainder of my life at Gibraltar , & moreover
../data/lines/g06/g06-096/g06-096-04.png: ( if even residence were not the condition ) , having

../data/lines/g06/g06-096/g06-096-06.png: you for the offer & to decline it .
../data/lines/g06/g06-101/g06-101-00.png: ' I remain , dear Melbourne , faithfully yours , ' ANGLESEY '
../data/lines/g06/g06-101/g06-101-01.png: Soon after his return from Europe , Clarence Paget
../data/lines/g06/g06-101/g06-101-02.png: had become seriously ill with a supposed abscess

../data/lines/g06/g06-105/g06-105-03.png: orthodox brethren . The main difficulty was how to

../data/lines/g06/g06-109/g06-109-02.png: travelling-carriage in the royal coach-houses , which

../data/lines/g07/g07-000a/g07-000a-09.p: CONCURRENCE , WHILE ' GENERAL ADAM WAS AT

../data/lines/g07/g07-000a/g07-000a-11.p: FERED IN THE SLIGHTEST DEGREE ABOUT ...
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-00.p: When he saw Trelawny's printed letter , Lord Sidney wrote
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-01.p: to Douglas Kinnaird saying that it was incorrect
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-02.p: throughout . He had no sooner heard from Count Gamba
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-03.p: and Fletcher that Byron would have wished his
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-04.p: body to return to England than that course was
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-05.p: ' immediately carried into effect ' - not in spite of himself
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-06.p: and Sir Frederick Stoven , but with their perfect con-
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-07.p: currence , while ' General Adam was at Corfu the whole
../data/lines/g07/g07-000b/g07-000b-08.p: time and # never interfered in the slightest
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-00.p: HIS ONLY REFERENCE TO TRELAWNY BY NAME IN
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-01.p: THE COURSE OF SEVERAL COMMUNICATIONS TO
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-02.p: HOBHOUSE AND KINNAIRD ABOUT BYRON'S AFFAIRS
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-03.p: IS SATIRICAL : ' I HAVE NOT THE 1HONOR OF ANY
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-04.p: ACQUAINTANCE WITH MR TRELAWNY WHO SEEMS TO
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-05.p: HAVE HAD CHARGE OF THE MULE WHEN COUNT
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-06.p: GAMBA ACCOMPANIED THE REMAINS OF OUR
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-07.p: DECEASED FRIEND TO ZANTE ... . . ' IF TRELAWNY
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-08.p: FAILED EVEN TO MEET LORD SIDNEY AND THE
../data/lines/g07/g07-003a/g07-003a-10.p: IN THE ISLANDS , WHILE THEY WARMLY WELCOMED ...
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-00.p: His only reference to Trelawny by name in the course of several
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-01.p: communications to Hobhouse and Kinnaird about Byron's affairs is
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-02.p: satirical : ' I have not the 1honor of any acquaintance with Mr
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-03.p: Trelawny who seems to have had charge of the Mule when Count
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-04.p: Gamba accompanied the remains of our deceased friend to Zante ... . '
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-05.p: If Trelawny failed even to meet Lord Sidney and the British
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-06.p: Government's other representatives in the islands , while they
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-07.p: warmly welcomed Gamba to their counsels , it would go far to
../data/lines/g07/g07-003b/g07-003b-08.p: explain his attempts to exalt himself at the young
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-00.p: IN HIS POPULAR AND ACUTELY UNRELIABLE
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-01.p: BOOK ON BYRON AND SHELLEY , TRELAWNY
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-02.p: IMPLIES THAT NOT ONLY GAMBA BUT FLETCHER
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-03.p: AND TITA AND THE STEWARD , LEGA ZAMBELLI ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-04.p: FAILED TO PERFORM THE MOST ELEMENTARY
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-05.p: DUTIES TOWARDS THE DEAD . HE PRETENDS
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-06.p: TO HAVE FOUND EVERYTHING IN UTTERMOST
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-08.p: HAD MOST TREASURED , SCATTERED ON THE
../data/lines/g07/g07-007a/g07-007a-09.p: FLOOR , - AS RUBBISH OF NO MARKE-
../data/lines/g07/g07-007b/g07-007b-00.p: In his popular and acutely unreliable book on Byron and
../data/lines/g07/g07-007b/g07-007b-01.p: Shelley , Trelawny implies that not only Gamba but Fletcher
../data/lines/g07/g07-007b/g07-007b-02.p: and Tita and the steward , Lega Zambelli , failed to perform
../data/lines/g07/g07-007b/g07-007b-03.p: the most elementary duties towards the dead . He pretends
../data/lines/g07/g07-007b/g07-007b-04.p: to have found everything in uttermost disorder - ' tokens that
../data/lines/g07/g07-007b/g07-007b-05.p: the Pilgrim had most treasured , scattered on the floor , -
../data/lines/g07/g07-007b/g07-007b-06.p: as rubbish of no marketable value , and trampled on ' .
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-00.p: This was to give colour to his pretext for copying Byron's last
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-01.p: letter to his sister , which was that its chance of reaching its
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-02.p: destination had seemed slight . The collection of Pietro
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-03.p: Gamba's letters deposited among the Murray manuscripts show
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-04.p: that the greatest care was observed in gathering together all the possessions
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-05.p: of a man whose importance was fully recognized by everyone about
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-06.p: him . ' I have had put under Government seal his belongings ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-07.p: which will be opened by Prince Alexander Mavrocordato
../data/lines/g07/g07-010b/g07-010b-08.p: in my presence and that of certain Englishmen who are
../data/lines/g07/g07-014/g07-014-00.png: I have taken an exact inventory of them . '
../data/lines/g07/g07-014/g07-014-01.png: Thus on April 21st , several days before
../data/lines/g07/g07-014/g07-014-02.png: Trelawny appeared , Gamba wrote to Lord
../data/lines/g07/g07-014/g07-014-03.png: Sidney Osborne , and his inventory has been
../data/lines/g07/g07-014/g07-014-04.png: preserved . The papers were reopened in the
../data/lines/g07/g07-014/g07-014-06.png: in order to make sure that no recent will
../data/lines/g07/g07-014b/g07-014b-00.p: I have taken an exact inventory of them . ' Thus on April 21st , several
../data/lines/g07/g07-014b/g07-014b-01.p: days before Trelawny appeared , Gamba wrote to Lord Sidney Osborne ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-014b/g07-014b-02.p: and his inventory has been preserved . The papers were reopened in
../data/lines/g07/g07-014b/g07-014b-03.p: the presence of leading Missolonghi officials in order to make
../data/lines/g07/g07-014b/g07-014b-04.p: sure that no recent will was amongst them .
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-00.p: It may have been then that Trelawny contrived to do
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-01.p: his copying . Considering that Pietro was not above
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-02.p: twenty-three years of age when he undertook a load
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-03.p: of heavy responsibilities , his conduct reveals him as
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-04.p: one of the most intelligent as well as the most
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-05.p: sympathetic of Byron's 6entourage in Greece . With
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-06.p: his good looks - for he ' carried the passport of a very
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-07.p: handsome person ' - his good manners and his perfect
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-08.p: lack of pretension , he even succeeded in disarming
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-09.p: Hobhouse's possessiveness and making him forget how
../data/lines/g07/g07-018a/g07-018a-10.p: deeply he had disapproved , less than two years
../data/lines/g07/g07-022a/g07-022a-00.p: Augusta Leigh too was favourably impressed ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-022a/g07-022a-01.p: and wrote to Lady Byron after she had
../data/lines/g07/g07-022a/g07-022a-02.p: received a visit from him : I have today seen

../data/lines/g07/g07-022a/g07-022a-06.p: spoke with great feeling . The unfortunate
../data/lines/g07/g07-022a/g07-022a-07.p: Augusta was in one of her worst states of
../data/lines/g07/g07-022b/g07-022b-00.p: Augusta Leigh too was favourably impressed , and wrote
../data/lines/g07/g07-022b/g07-022b-01.p: to Lady Byron after she had received a visit from
../data/lines/g07/g07-022b/g07-022b-02.p: him : I have today seen Count Gamba - which was very
../data/lines/g07/g07-022b/g07-022b-03.p: distressing for many reasons but quite unavoidable -
../data/lines/g07/g07-022b/g07-022b-04.p: he is a pleasing , fine looking young man & spoke
../data/lines/g07/g07-022b/g07-022b-05.p: with great feeling . The unfortunate Augusta was
../data/lines/g07/g07-022b/g07-022b-06.p: in one of her worst states of confusion .
../data/lines/g07/g07-026a/g07-026a-00.p: She had loved Byron , but she had
../data/lines/g07/g07-026a/g07-026a-01.p: betrayed him , betrayed him not twice , as
../data/lines/g07/g07-026a/g07-026a-02.p: he had betrayed her , but again and again
../data/lines/g07/g07-026a/g07-026a-03.p: over a long span of time , fawning on his
../data/lines/g07/g07-026a/g07-026a-04.p: implacable wife , purveying to her in secret

../data/lines/g07/g07-026a/g07-026a-06.p: any eye but her own would see , feeding
../data/lines/g07/g07-026a/g07-026a-07.p: the stealthy fires of her animosity : and
../data/lines/g07/g07-026a/g07-026a-08.p: having betrayed him , she had grown to fear
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-00.p: She had loved Byron , but she had betrayed him ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-01.p: betrayed him not twice , as he had betrayed her ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-02.p: but again and again over a long span of time ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-03.p: fawning on his implacable wife , purveying to her
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-04.p: in secret the unguarded letters he never
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-05.p: suspected any eye but her own would see ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-06.p: feeding the stealthy fires of her animosity :
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-07.p: and having betrayed him , she had grown to
../data/lines/g07/g07-026b/g07-026b-08.p: fear and almost to hate him .
../data/lines/g07/g07-028a/g07-028a-00.p: She had dreaded his outpourings of affection
../data/lines/g07/g07-028a/g07-028a-01.p: for her in poetry that he thought would clear
../data/lines/g07/g07-028a/g07-028a-02.p: her and that only compromised her , and the
../data/lines/g07/g07-028a/g07-028a-03.p: headstrong folly that tempted him to write on
../data/lines/g07/g07-028a/g07-028a-04.p: ever more daring themes , teaching the world
../data/lines/g07/g07-028a/g07-028a-05.p: to guess what repentance and unrepentance
../data/lines/g07/g07-028b/g07-028b-00.p: She had dreaded his outpourings of affection for

../data/lines/g07/g07-028b/g07-028b-02.p: her and that only compromised her , and #
