../data/lines/g07/g07-028b/g07-028b-05.p: the world to guess what repentance and
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-00.png: She had dreaded still more that he might
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-01.png: return to England , overshadowing her again
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-02.png: with spiritual and social peril . But this kind
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-03.png: of return was what she could never have
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-04.png: foreseen ... that he # should come back not
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-05.png: voluble but silent , not beautiful but defaced ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-06.png: not in obloquy but with his praises ringing !
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-07.png: She could remember now his exciting laughter ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-030/g07-030-08.png: his almost filial love for her , her almost
../data/lines/g07/g07-034/g07-034-00.png: Above all she could remember the anguish of their
../data/lines/g07/g07-034/g07-034-01.png: parting , and how he had been ' convulsed , absolutely
../data/lines/g07/g07-034/g07-034-02.png: convulsed with grief ' . So love revived , and in
../data/lines/g07/g07-034/g07-034-03.png: its most sentimental form . While he lived
../data/lines/g07/g07-034/g07-034-04.png: she had lost touch in her perpetual alarms
../data/lines/g07/g07-034/g07-034-05.png: with what was best in him ; dead his memory
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-00.png: She felt almost as strongly as Hobhouse
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-01.png: # about biographies . Quite apart from the
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-02.png: divagations of her ' poor brother ' - so she
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-03.png: constantly referred to him - there were a
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-04.png: hundred reasons why it would be
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-05.png: objectionable to have the family history
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-06.png: exposed . Whatever latitude she allowed in
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-07.png: the warmth of her kindly nature to others -
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-08.png: or to herself - she believed implicitly in
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-09.png: the moral code she had learned from
../data/lines/g07/g07-038/g07-038-10.png: her good grandmother , the Countess of
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-00.png: She had no desire to see in print that her
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-01.png: mother , who was to have been a duchess , had
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-02.png: been involved in a scandalous and ruinous
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-03.png: divorce , that her father , ' Mad Jack Byron ' , was
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-04.png: a profligate and a bankrupt who had
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-05.png: squandered every penny two successive wives
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-06.png: had brought him and left the second on
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-07.png: the verge of destitution , and that he had died
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-08.png: a drunkard and perhaps a suicide , hiding
../data/lines/g07/g07-042/g07-042-09.png: in France to escape his creditors .
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-00.png: It was no more pleasant for the Hon. Augusta
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-01.png: Leigh to share this kind of story with the world
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-02.png: than it would be for most 20th-century ladies
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-03.png: moving in court circles and having children to
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-04.png: be settled advantageously in life . She had lived
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-05.png: down the rumours which had made the year of
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-06.png: the Byron separation a nightmare to her , and she
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-07.png: had also succeeded , though with an increasing
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-08.png: sense of effort , in persuading her little world to
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-09.png: avert its eyes from her husband , ' that drone ' ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-044/g07-044-10.png: as # Byron called him , whose career of
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-00.png: She had earned the right to be left in peace .
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-01.png: Byron's fame was , of course , very wonderful , but
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-02.png: it carried with it too many reminders of his
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-03.png: terrible indiscretions - the writing of Don Juan ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-04.png: which she had never ceased to deplore , his
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-05.png: shocking blasphemies like the Vision of Judgement ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-06.png: his making friends with the atheist known to
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-07.png: her as ' that infamous Mr. Shelley ' , and his
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-08.png: mixing with really low and horrid people such
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-09.png: as the subversive journalist Leigh Hunt , whom
../data/lines/g07/g07-047/g07-047-10.png: on would never conceivably meet in decent society .
../data/lines/g07/g07-050/g07-050-00.png: She was most emphatically opposed to the
../data/lines/g07/g07-050/g07-050-01.png: production of sheer indelicacies , and that was
../data/lines/g07/g07-050/g07-050-02.png: the light in which she saw the proposed book
../data/lines/g07/g07-050/g07-050-03.png: by Dallas . Letters between a mother and a son -
../data/lines/g07/g07-050/g07-050-04.png: a son so outspoken and a mother so far from
../data/lines/g07/g07-050/g07-050-05.png: suitable to be paraded before the public !
../data/lines/g07/g07-050/g07-050-06.png: And brought out by that seedy poor relation ,
../data/lines/g07/g07-050/g07-050-07.png: Dallas ! Could anything be in worse taste ?
../data/lines/g07/g07-065/g07-065-00.png: Hanson , the solicitor , was naturally remunerated
../data/lines/g07/g07-065/g07-065-01.png: for his services , but all Mr Hobhouse's duties
../data/lines/g07/g07-065/g07-065-02.png: as executor were performed without reward .
../data/lines/g07/g07-065/g07-065-03.png: And now there was more trouble brewing
../data/lines/g07/g07-065/g07-065-05.png: senior was detained in Paris by severe
../data/lines/g07/g07-065/g07-065-06.png: illness , but Dallas junior was full of
../data/lines/g07/g07-065/g07-065-07.png: fight and applying for the injunction
../data/lines/g07/g07-069a/g07-069a-00.p: He had gone to Byron's cousin , now 7th
../data/lines/g07/g07-069a/g07-069a-01.p: lord , and had got him to compose an
../data/lines/g07/g07-069a/g07-069a-02.p: affidavit to the effect that , whereas he
../data/lines/g07/g07-069a/g07-069a-03.p: had formerly been reluctant to approve the
../data/lines/g07/g07-069a/g07-069a-04.p: publication unless it had first been
../data/lines/g07/g07-069a/g07-069a-05.p: examined by the relatives and friends of
../data/lines/g07/g07-069a/g07-069a-06.p: his predecessor , he had now read the
../data/lines/g07/g07-069a/g07-069a-07.p: book and was content for it to be
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-00.p: There were few things in Augusta's whole
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-01.p: life , full of calamities though it was , that
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-02.p: hurt her more than this contemptuous slight
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-03.p: from George Anson Byron , whom she had
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-04.p: loved with an unswerving loyalty , and had looked
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-05.p: on as her intimate friend . Moreover , he
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-06.p: was without the right to make such
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-08.p: from her brother but his title , whereas
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-09.p: she was not only of nearer consanguinity
../data/lines/g07/g07-071a/g07-071a-10.p: but the chosen recipient of his property .
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-00.p: These , if she had only known it , were
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-01.p: precisely the reasons why her cousin took
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-02.p: pleasure in the opportunity of annoying her .
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-03.p: Lady Byron did not like Augusta to have
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-04.p: intimate friends , and in every instance where
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-05.p: the occasion was granted her , she managed
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-06.p: to find some excuse for bestowing , in whole
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-07.p: or in part , those confidences which never
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-08.p: failed to leave her audience agape with
../data/lines/g07/g07-074a/g07-074a-09.p: wonder at her magnanimity and Augusta's
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-00.p: George Anson Byron had seen enough of
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-01.p: the poet's atrocious conduct as a husband
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-02.p: to be aware that Augusta , so far from
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-03.p: being responsible for the collapse of the
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-04.p: marriage , had been Lady Byron's greatest
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-05.p: support and comfort at the time ; but it
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-06.p: had been deemed necessary all the
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-07.p: same to enlighten him as to the suspicions
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-08.p: in the background , and he had repeated
../data/lines/g07/g07-077a/g07-077a-09.p: them to his newly married wife .
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-00.p: Their friendship for Augusta became rather
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-01.p: hollow , and the news that Byron had left
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-02.p: her practically all his money caused it to
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-03.p: crumble to oblivion . Though Lady Byron
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-04.p: knew perfectly well that Byron , as early
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-05.p: as the year of their wedding , 1815 , had
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-06.p: made a will in Augusta's favour , she had
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-07.p: evidently not passed on that information ;
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-08.p: and it came as an appalling surprise to
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-09.p: Captain Byron that he had been left
../data/lines/g07/g07-079a/g07-079a-10.p: without the fortune that would keep up the
../data/lines/g07/g07-084/g07-084-00.png: ' Respecting the will ' , he wrote to Byron's widow a few days after
../data/lines/g07/g07-084/g07-084-01.png: hearing its contents , ' the very thought of it is painful to me .
../data/lines/g07/g07-084/g07-084-02.png: What Mary has said about it is too true . ' What Mary , the
../data/lines/g07/g07-084/g07-084-03.png: new Lady Byron , had said about it was written on the first half
../data/lines/g07/g07-084/g07-084-04.png: sheet of the same paper : My dearest Annabella , The more we
../data/lines/g07/g07-084/g07-084-05.png: consider the most prominent subject in your letter , the more
../data/lines/g07/g07-084/g07-084-06.png: we are convinced of the truth of that dreadful history
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-00.png: Questions about marriage and children were
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-01.png: again included , as they had been at the
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-02.png: 1911 and 1951 Censuses . The former had asked
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-03.png: for marriage details for all married women ,
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-04.png: the latter for all married women under
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-05.png: the age of 50 . The 1961 Census questions
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-06.png: related to all women who were or had been
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-07.png: married , and so repeated the enquiry made
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-08.png: fifteen years earlier by the 1946 Family
../data/lines/h01/h01-000/h01-000-09.png: Census conducted on behalf of the Royal
../data/lines/h01/h01-004/h01-004-00.png: The questions about children were the same as in 1951 ,
../data/lines/h01/h01-004/h01-004-01.png: except that they extended to all women who were or had
../data/lines/h01/h01-004/h01-004-02.png: been married . It was not regarded as practicable within
../data/lines/h01/h01-004/h01-004-03.png: the limits of the census to include particulars about
../data/lines/h01/h01-004/h01-004-04.png: the date of birth of each child , as had been done
../data/lines/h01/h01-004/h01-004-05.png: in the specialised enquiry for the Royal Commission .
../data/lines/h01/h01-007/h01-007-00.png: The innovation at the 1961 Census , though the
../data/lines/h01/h01-007/h01-007-02.png: the question , was the date of termination
../data/lines/h01/h01-007/h01-007-03.png: of the first or only marriage . This enables
../data/lines/h01/h01-007/h01-007-04.png: statistical use to be made of their experience
../data/lines/h01/h01-007/h01-007-05.png: as regards duration of marriage and
../data/lines/h01/h01-007/h01-007-06.png: number of children in the case of women

../data/lines/h01/h01-007/h01-007-08.png: by widowhood or divorce after the end

../data/lines/h04/h04-049/h04-049-05.png: 76 . Most groups spent slightly less on potatoes than in

../data/lines/h04/h04-052/h04-052-09.png: wholly-adult households was 0.5 oz. per head per week .
../data/lines/h04/h04-055/h04-055-00.png: The two latter groups consumed much smaller
../data/lines/h04/h04-055/h04-055-01.png: quantities per head of canned vegetables and canned and
../data/lines/h04/h04-055/h04-055-02.png: bottled tomatoes than any other group , and much smaller
../data/lines/h04/h04-055/h04-055-03.png: quantities of canned and bottled fruit than younger
../data/lines/h04/h04-055/h04-055-04.png: childless couples ; in households containing children ,
../data/lines/h04/h04-055/h04-055-05.png: consumption of canned fruit fell off sharply with
../data/lines/h04/h04-055/h04-055-06.png: increasing family size , but there was no regular
../data/lines/h04/h04-055/h04-055-07.png: gradation in purchases of canned vegetables and canned
../data/lines/h04/h04-057/h04-057-00.png: All types of household benefited from the improved
../data/lines/h04/h04-057/h04-057-01.png: supplies and lower prices of fresh fruit compared
../data/lines/h04/h04-057/h04-057-02.png: with 1958 , but the increase in consumption was
../data/lines/h04/h04-057/h04-057-03.png: least in families containing children . 77 . Total
../data/lines/h04/h04-057/h04-057-05.png: although most types of household bought less
../data/lines/h04/h04-057/h04-057-06.png: white bread and more rolls and speciality
../data/lines/h04/h04-057/h04-057-07.png: breads than in 1958 . Most groups increased
../data/lines/h04/h04-057/h04-057-08.png: their purchases of puddings , cakes and biscuits ,
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-00.png: 78 . Regression estimates of the expenditure on
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-01.png: different commodities attributable to the adult
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-02.png: couple and each additional child in a selected
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-03.png: group of households consisting of childless couples
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-04.png: ( both under 55 ) and couples with different numbers
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-05.png: of children were given for 1952-56 in Table 39 of
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-06.png: the Annual Report for 1956 . The younger childless
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-07.png: couples are broadly comparable in age and family
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-08.png: income with the family households , so that differences
../data/lines/h04/h04-061/h04-061-09.png: in food expenditure may be associated with the
../data/lines/h04/h04-071/h04-071-00.png: The relative expenditure per child declined from 1952 to 1956 ,
../data/lines/h04/h04-071/h04-071-01.png: but rose in 1957 when the subsidy on welfare and national dried
../data/lines/h04/h04-071/h04-071-02.png: milk was reduced ; since 1957 it has again declined . Most of the
../data/lines/h04/h04-071/h04-071-03.png: average expenditure associated with a child was on cereal foods ,
../data/lines/h04/h04-071/h04-071-04.png: potatoes and milk ; for fresh green vegetables , fruit , cheese , fish and
../data/lines/h04/h04-071/h04-071-05.png: carcase meat , the incremental expenditure was slight .
../data/lines/h04/h04-074/h04-074-00.png: 79 . Table 30 shows the energy value and nutrient content of
../data/lines/h04/h04-074/h04-074-01.png: the diets of households of different composition . The averages
../data/lines/h04/h04-074/h04-074-02.png: showed little change compared with those for the previous year ,
../data/lines/h04/h04-074/h04-074-03.png: except for generally increased intakes of vitamins C and D .
../data/lines/h04/h04-074/h04-074-04.png: Since physiological requirements vary widely with age , sex
../data/lines/h04/h04-074/h04-074-05.png: and level of activity , comparisons between families of different
../data/lines/h04/h04-074/h04-074-06.png: composition are only apposite when considered in relation
../data/lines/h04/h04-078/h04-078-00.png: 80 . Estimates of the adequacy of the diets , assessed by
../data/lines/h04/h04-078/h04-078-01.png: comparison with allowances based on the recommendations
../data/lines/h04/h04-078/h04-078-02.png: of the British Medical Association , are also shown in Table 30 .
../data/lines/h04/h04-078/h04-078-03.png: In comparison with the previous year , changes were small
../data/lines/h04/h04-078/h04-078-04.png: except for higher estimates for vitamin C . In families with
../data/lines/h04/h04-078/h04-078-05.png: four or more children the levels of adequacy for all
../data/lines/h04/h04-078/h04-078-06.png: nutrients other than vitamin C decreased slightly .
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-00.png: For this fairly small group , comparisons between different
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-01.png: years cannot be made so precisely as in groups with a
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-02.png: defined number of children . In 1959 the households in
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-03.png: this group contained slightly more children ( average 4.64 )
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-04.png: than in the previous year ( average 4.53 ) . Their total food
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-05.png: expenditure increased less than that in other groups ,
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-06.png: and they purchased more of certain foods such as fish ,
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-07.png: poultry , eggs , canned vegetables , fresh fruit , chocolate
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-08.png: biscuits and breakfast cereals which , in general , are more
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-09.png: expensive sources of nutrients than those foods of which
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-10.png: they purchased less , namely dried milk , potatoes , carcase
../data/lines/h04/h04-082/h04-082-11.png: meat , sugar , bread , flour and oatmeal and oat products .
../data/lines/h05/h05-012/h05-012-00.png: 5 . Other forms of war damage payment made by the Commission
../data/lines/h05/h05-012/h05-012-01.png: are highway payments , clearance payments ( for clearing remains of
../data/lines/h05/h05-012/h05-012-02.png: structures from " total loss " sites ) and church payments . Although
../data/lines/h05/h05-012/h05-012-03.png: differing in certain important ways from the ordinary cost of
../data/lines/h05/h05-012/h05-012-04.png: works payments , the sums paid under these heads have the
../data/lines/h05/h05-012/h05-012-05.png: common feature that they are all payments in respect of works
../data/lines/h06/h06-000/h06-000-00.png: To provide fuller information about certain types of
../data/lines/h06/h06-000/h06-000-01.png: dangerous occurrence , Section 65 of the Factories Act ,
../data/lines/h06/h06-000/h06-000-03.png: occurrences to H.M. District Inspectors of Factories ,
../data/lines/h06/h06-000/h06-000-04.png: whether or not they result in injury . Appendix 20
../data/lines/h06/h06-000/h06-000-05.png: gives figures of dangerous occurrences reported in
../data/lines/h06/h06-000/h06-000-06.png: 1960 ; the types of occurrence which have to be
../data/lines/h06/h06-000/h06-000-07.png: reported are set out in the heading to the Appendix .
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-00.png: The total number of dangerous occurrences reported
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-01.png: during the year was 1,409 , an increase of 111 over
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-02.png: the total for 1959 . However , the number of
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-03.png: notifiable accidents associated with occurrences fell
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-04.png: from 252 ( 31 of them fatal ) in 1959 to
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-05.png: 245 ( 22 fatal ) in 1960 . The main increase in
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-06.png: the numbers of occurrences reported occurred in the
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-07.png: category of those due to the collapse or
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-08.png: failure of a crane , derrick , winch or hoist , where
../data/lines/h06/h06-003/h06-003-09.png: there was an increase of almost one-third from
../data/lines/h06/h06-079/h06-079-00.png: The equipment takes two forms - an insulating
../data/lines/h06/h06-079/h06-079-01.png: guard on the jib of the crane , intended to
../data/lines/h06/h06-079/h06-079-02.png: prevent direct contact with the line , and
../data/lines/h06/h06-079/h06-079-03.png: electronic equipment with a sensitive probe
../data/lines/h06/h06-079/h06-079-04.png: mounted slightly forward of the head of the
../data/lines/h06/h06-079/h06-079-06.png: and warning apparatus in the driver's
../data/lines/h06/h06-079/h06-079-07.png: cab . Improved designs of both forms
../data/lines/h06/h06-079/h06-079-08.png: are being tried out at present .
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-00.png: There is , however , a danger that workers
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-01.png: will rely too much on fixed devices because
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-02.png: they fail to recognise their limitations .
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-03.png: It is therefore safer both in principle and
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-04.png: practice to keep the worker away from
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-05.png: overhead lines wherever possible , e.g. , by
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-06.png: ( 1 ) re-routing the line , ( 2 ) putting the supply
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-08.png: dead ( after consultation with the supply
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-09.png: authority ) , ( 4 ) providing barriers at a safe
../data/lines/h06/h06-082/h06-082-10.png: distance to prevent vehicles from approaching
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-00.png: It is also important to remember that on
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-01.png: lines carrying the higher voltages flashover
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-02.png: from the line may take place without
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-03.png: actual contact . A new type of
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-04.png: machine has recently been developed for
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-05.png: the automatic rolling of sole leather
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-06.png: bends . The sheet of leather is placed
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-07.png: on a sliding feed tray outside the
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-08.png: danger zone and is then pushed
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-09.png: forward between two platens , the upper
../data/lines/h06/h06-085/h06-085-10.png: one carrying a set of small rollers .
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-00.png: The lower platen , which supports the
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-01.png: leather , is raised hydraulically to bring
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-02.png: it into contact with the rollers on the upper
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-03.png: platen , which is then caused to make
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-04.png: several horizontal oscillations so that the
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-05.png: leather is rolled and pressed at the same time .
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-06.png: The danger zone between the platens is fenced
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-07.png: by a guard which is interlocked with the
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-08.png: hydraulic valve and the press is also
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-09.png: sequentially operated : the closing of the shutter
../data/lines/h06/h06-089/h06-089-10.png: starts the machine , the rest of the cycle
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-00.png: A new method of applying sand to the
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-01.png: faces of green bricks has recently been
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-02.png: developed . In the case of wire-cut bricks
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-03.png: the column of clay from the pug-mill is
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-04.png: carried by a short length of belt
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-06.png: This consists basically of a vibrating
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-07.png: hopper from which the sand is
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-08.png: distributed to all four faces by a
../data/lines/h06/h06-092/h06-092-09.png: system of slots , scrapers and worms .
../data/lines/h06/h06-096/h06-096-00.png: The conveyor is broken at this point to
../data/lines/h06/h06-096/h06-096-01.png: enable the sand to be applied to
../data/lines/h06/h06-096/h06-096-02.png: the under surface of the column , which
../data/lines/h06/h06-096/h06-096-03.png: passes on through two pairs of
../data/lines/h06/h06-096/h06-096-04.png: vibrating rollers which embed the sand
../data/lines/h06/h06-096/h06-096-05.png: firmly in the surfaces and is finally
../data/lines/h06/h06-096/h06-096-06.png: cut into bricks at the wire cutting
../data/lines/h07/h07-000/h07-000-00.png: Of over 7,000,000 square feet of factory space built by the
../data/lines/h07/h07-000/h07-000-01.png: development corporations , about 20 per cent represents
../data/lines/h07/h07-000/h07-000-02.png: extensions built after the firms had become established .
../data/lines/h07/h07-000/h07-000-03.png: It is the policy of the corporations to charge full rack-
../data/lines/h07/h07-000/h07-000-04.png: rents or ground rents for their factories or industrial
../data/lines/h07/h07-000/h07-000-05.png: sites ; and rents vary considerably according to the demand
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-00.png: The average gross return on established industrial estates
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-01.png: ranges from 7 to 9 per cent of the capital expenditure on land ,
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-02.png: site works and buildings . Manufacturing industry affords
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-03.png: employment to large numbers of non-manual as well as
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-04.png: manual workers . An analysis made by Crawley Development
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-05.png: Corporation in 1958 , after collating replies from fifty-eight
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-06.png: manufacturing firms employing over nine thousand staff ,
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-07.png: showed that 5 per cent of the staff were classed as
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-08.png: managerial and administrative , 11 per cent as technical
../data/lines/h07/h07-003/h07-003-09.png: or employed in research and 19 per cent as clerical .
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-00.png: There is no reason to suppose that this pattern is peculiar to
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-01.png: Crawley . The development corporations have aimed at a varied
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-02.png: pattern of industry , offering a reasonable choice of
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-03.png: employer as well as choice of occupation for men , women and
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-04.png: school-leavers , with due regard to the industries
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-05.png: already established in their towns . Inevitably engineering ,
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-06.png: including the motor vehicle and aircraft industries ,
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-07.png: predominates in all the London new towns since these are
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-08.png: among the industries which have expanded most
../data/lines/h07/h07-007/h07-007-09.png: during the last ten years in the country generally .
../data/lines/h07/h07-011/h07-011-00.png: Of those at present employed in manufacturing industry
../data/lines/h07/h07-011/h07-011-01.png: in the eight London new towns about 40 per cent are
../data/lines/h07/h07-011/h07-011-02.png: employed in engineering and electrical goods manufacture -
../data/lines/h07/h07-011/h07-011-03.png: the proportion employed in both these groups combined
../data/lines/h07/h07-011/h07-011-04.png: varies from about 30 per cent in Welwyn to 85 per cent in
../data/lines/h07/h07-011/h07-011-05.png: Stevenage and 90 per cent in Hatfield .
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-00.png: These figures are much higher than the national
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-01.png: averages , and may be thought to indicate a
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-02.png: lack of balance in some of the towns . On the other
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-03.png: hand these groups offer fairly varied opportunities of
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-04.png: skilled employment and are highly diversified
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-05.png: as regards products , markets and methods of
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-06.png: manufacture . Consumer goods industries such as the
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-07.png: manufacture of food # and drink , tobacco , clothing
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-08.png: and footwear are under-represented in the new
../data/lines/h07/h07-013/h07-013-09.png: towns generally though not in Basildon and

../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-00.p: All types of trader have been encouraged ,
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-01.p: from the large departmental store to #
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-02.p: the small shoe-mender , with banks specially
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-03.p: sited on corners or in separate courts to avoid
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-04.p: breaking into the shopping frontage . As in the
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-05.p: case of factories and industrial sites , the
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-06.p: corporations' policy has been to charge full commercial
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-07.p: rents for their shops and shopping sites . The
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-08.p: cost of town centre development has been very
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-09.p: high in some cases with large paved areas
../data/lines/h07/h07-040b/h07-040b-10.p: and pleasant amenities and decorative features .
../data/lines/h07/h07-044a/h07-044a-00.p: The gross return on capital expendi-
../data/lines/h07/h07-044a/h07-044a-01.p: ture on town and neighbourhood shopping
../data/lines/h07/h07-044a/h07-044a-02.p: centres ranges from 6 to 13 per cent.
../data/lines/h07/h07-044a/h07-044a-03.p: It is to their successful industries and
../data/lines/h07/h07-044a/h07-044a-05.p: corporations must look to recoup the
../data/lines/h07/h07-044a/h07-044a-06.p: high costs of main sewerage and
../data/lines/h07/h07-044a/h07-044a-07.p: drainage , main roads and other special
../data/lines/h07/h07-051b/h07-051b-00.p: These services develop at their own pace
../data/lines/h07/h07-051b/h07-051b-01.p: in response to local demand , however ,
../data/lines/h07/h07-051b/h07-051b-02.p: and little can be done to stimulate them .
../data/lines/h07/h07-051b/h07-051b-03.p: In practice it has not proved possible
../data/lines/h07/h07-051b/h07-051b-04.p: as yet to attract " head offices and
../data/lines/h07/h07-051b/h07-051b-07.p: ments and other public offices " on the
../data/lines/h07/h07-051b/h07-051b-08.p: scale needed " to establish the character
../data/lines/h07/h07-051b/h07-051b-09.p: of the town from the outset as one
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-00.p: Except at Hemel Hempstead , large office
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-01.p: organisations have until quite recently shown
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-02.p: little interest in the new towns , probably because of
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-03.p: the difficulty in the early years in recruiting
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-04.p: suitable staff , especially junior staff , locally .
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-05.p: There is evidence of greater interest today ,
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-06.p: with nearly half a million square feet of
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-07.p: office space under construction - almost as
../data/lines/h07/h07-054a/h07-054a-08.p: much as the total area so far completed .
../data/lines/h07/h07-057a/h07-057a-00.p: This interest is likely to grow as employers become
../data/lines/h07/h07-057a/h07-057a-01.p: aware of the advantages of setting up offices in towns
../data/lines/h07/h07-057a/h07-057a-02.p: with a young and growing population and excellent
../data/lines/h07/h07-057a/h07-057a-03.p: schools and technical colleges . Towards the end of

../data/lines/h07/h07-057a/h07-057a-06.p: in central London , drawing their attention to the
../data/lines/h07/h07-057a/h07-057a-07.p: opportunities offered by the new towns .

../data/lines/j06/j06-051/j06-051-02.png: when it occurs before dawn ; but this
../data/lines/j06/j06-051/j06-051-08.png: migrations upon changes in light intensity
../data/lines/j06/j06-051/j06-051-09.png: is beyond doubt . Yet in spite
../data/lines/j06/j06-051/j06-051-10.png: of a great amount of work ,
../data/lines/j06/j06-056/j06-056-01.png: of light as the governing factor
../data/lines/j06/j06-056/j06-056-02.png: but combined its influence with that
../data/lines/j06/j06-056/j06-056-03.png: of gravity . Later authors , in particular
../data/lines/j07/j07-000/j07-000-00.png: This resulted in units of much lighter weight than could be
../data/lines/j07/j07-000/j07-000-01.png: obtained with tubular constructions . The growth of the
../data/lines/j07/j07-000/j07-000-02.png: aircraft industry brought even greater emphasis to the need
../data/lines/j07/j07-000/j07-000-03.png: for lightweight compact heat exchangers . During the 1930's ,
../data/lines/j07/j07-000/j07-000-05.png: became established for aero-engine radiators , using
../data/lines/j07/j07-000/j07-000-06.png: dip-soldered copper . The air and engine-coolant passages
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-00.png: The air passages were packed with corrugated
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-01.png: foil bonded to the primary plates to
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-02.png: provide the necessary surface area for heat transfer .
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-03.png: The narrower coolant passages were also packed with foil ,
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-04.png: chiefly to provide sufficient support for the flat plates to withstand
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-05.png: the coolant pressure loadings . The introduction of the aluminium alloy
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-06.png: dip-brazing process in the early 1940's was quickly taken up
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-07.png: for aircraft heat exchangers and led to substantial
../data/lines/j07/j07-005/j07-005-08.png: weight reductions as compared with copper construction .
../data/lines/j07/j07-009/j07-009-00.png: This development coincided with the introduction of
../data/lines/j07/j07-009/j07-009-01.png: pressurized aircraft cabins and the demand for air-to-air
../data/lines/j07/j07-009/j07-009-02.png: cabin coolers . Although in this case the heat transfer
../data/lines/j07/j07-009/j07-009-03.png: coefficients on the two sides of the heat exchanger
../data/lines/j07/j07-009/j07-009-04.png: were of comparable magnitude , the use of
../data/lines/j07/j07-009/j07-009-05.png: secondary surface was still attractive , since the
../data/lines/j07/j07-009/j07-009-06.png: greater part of the surface area could be made up
../data/lines/j07/j07-009/j07-009-07.png: of fins only 0.006 in. ( 0.15 mm. ) thick .
../data/lines/j07/j07-012/j07-012-00.png: Furthermore , developments in the detail form of
../data/lines/j07/j07-012/j07-012-01.png: the fins made possible a reduction in the total
../data/lines/j07/j07-012/j07-012-02.png: surface area required as compared with the use of
../data/lines/j07/j07-012/j07-012-03.png: smooth continuous passages for the same thermal
../data/lines/j07/j07-012/j07-012-04.png: duty and pressure losses . The properties of
../data/lines/j07/j07-012/j07-012-05.png: compact form , low weight , and design flexibility
../data/lines/j07/j07-012/j07-012-06.png: thus developed found ready application on a
../data/lines/j07/j07-012/j07-012-07.png: much larger scale with the introduction of tonnage
../data/lines/j07/j07-015/j07-015-00.png: The basic method of construction is both simple and
../data/lines/j07/j07-015/j07-015-02.png: arrangement of a single passage . This can be
../data/lines/j07/j07-015/j07-015-03.png: extended in length and width up to the limit of
../data/lines/j07/j07-015/j07-015-05.png: is machine-formed , thus ensuring a high standard
../data/lines/j07/j07-015/j07-015-06.png: of uniformity in height and fin pitch .

../data/lines/l07/l07-080/l07-080-08.png: because he did not know the

../data/lines/r06/r06-003/r06-003-00.png: One called La Patriote is Communist , and at the time

../data/lines/r06/r06-003/r06-003-02.png: tomatoes at General de Gaulle . One side of this square

../data/lines/r06/r06-003/r06-003-07.png: had firmly closed the door in our noses .
../data/lines/r06/r06-007/r06-007-00.png: ' It is a pity , ' said Mart , ' because it would have been

../data/lines/r06/r06-011/r06-011-05.png: We were shown around by Pierre .

../data/lines/r06/r06-018/r06-018-05.png: We were woken up twice about dawn by a soft
